title: How to calculate the mass of an object given its specific gravity and the density of water - Quora

response.answer_text: Using only that information, you can't. An iron pin and an all-iron battleship have the same specific gravity. If you can measure the volume of the object, you can calculate from the resulting three pieces of data - but two are not enough.
Submerge it in a known volume of water. The volume of the water displaced multiplied by the specific gravity of your material is its mass. Ex. 100 mL displaced SG 1.3 100 mL x 1.3 g/mL = 130 g
